name: Cicuta virosa
Relationship: Compare: CICUTA MACULATA - Water Hemlock - (Effects very similar; the most prominent symptoms being: Falls unconscious, tetanic or clonic convulsions. Body covered with sweat. Consider in epilepsy and tetanus. Tincture and lower potencies.) HYDROCY. ACID; CON.; Oenanthe.; STRYCHNIA; BELLAD.Antidotes: OPIUM; ARN.

Eyes: Strabismus; periodic, spasmodic after a fall or blow
Spasmodic affections of eyes and its appendages
Pupils get behind upper lids as head inclines
Objects recede, approach, and seem double
Respiratory: Chest feels tight; can hardly breathe
Stomach: Throbbing in pit of stomach, which has become raised to size of fist
Indigestion, with insensibility, frothing at mouth
Desire for unnatural things, like coal
Head: Vertigo, with gastralgia, and muscular spasms
Sudden, violent shocks through head
Thick, yellow scabs on head
Stares persistently at objects
Cervical muscles contracted
Cerebrospinal meningitis
Head symptoms relieved by emission of flatus
Convulsions from concussion of brain
Head turned or twisted to one side
Back and Extremities: Jerking, tearing in coccyx, especially during menses
Spasms and cramps in muscles of nape of neck, and spasmodic drawing backward of head
Back bent backward like an arch
Curved limbs cannot be straightened nor straight ones bent
Mind: Delirium, with singing, dancing and funny gestures
Confounds present with the past; feels like a child
Face: Pustules which run together forming thick, yellow scabs on face and head, corners of mouth and chin, with burning pain
Skin: Elevated eruptions, as large as peas
Eczema; no itching; exudation forms into a hard, lemon-colored crust
Throat: Effects on oesophagus from swallowing sharp piece of bone
Rectum: Diarrhoea in morning, with irresistible desire to urinate

details: The action on the nervous system, producing spasmodic affections, viz., hiccough, trismus, tetanus, and convulsions, give the pathological picture calling especially for this remedy, whenever this is further characterized, by the more individual symptoms of the drug. Among these, are the BENDING OF THE HEAD, NECK, AND SPINE BACKWARDS, and the general action of the patient is VIOLENT, with frightful distortions. Violent, strange desires. Sensation of internal chill. Moaning and howling. Does absurd things. Marked action on the skin.
